TEXT: The applicants , Mr PERSON and Mr PERSON , are NORP nationals and live in GPE and NORP ( GPE ) . The first applicant is represented before the ORG by Mr G. Abela , a lawyer practising in GPE , while the second applicant is represented by Mr T. Abela and Mrs T. Cachia , CARDINAL lawyers practising respectively in ORG and GPE .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the applicants , may be summarised as follows .
The applicants were CARDINAL judges of ORG . They had been suspected , inter alia , of having accepted a sum of money in order to neglect their duties as public officials .

On DATE , while the applicants were being interrogated by the police , the Prime Minister of GPE called a press conference at his office and issued a press release in LANGUAGE . The translation into LANGUAGE of this document read as follows :
“ I have convened ORG on a matter of importance which I feel that the public should be informed of officially .
The courts of our land have always enjoyed , and still do , the trust of our people .
I regret that I have to inform the public that DATE CARDINAL judges are being investigated by the police in connection with serious offences .
On DATE , judgment was delivered by ORG presided over by Chief Justice PERSON , Judge PERSON and Judge PERSON , in the case of “ GPE vs. PERSON ” .
Before ORG , the accused was found guilty , after he had filed a guilty plea , of offences regarding drug trafficking and other related offences , and was condemned to DATE imprisonment .

DATE before the judgment of ORG , it became known that contacts were being made on behalf of the accused with Judge PERSON and the Chief Justice so that the prison term to which he had been condemned be reduced by DATE , from DATE , and that these CARDINAL judges were promised amounts of CARDINAL of PERSON each .
Judgment was given as allegedly had been agreed .
The Police continued to follow subsequent events . After the judgment it resulted that monies were paid to the said CARDINAL judges .
The investigations together with interrogations of witnesses began after Judge PERSON returned from abroad on DATE .
The investigations are continuing DATE as the CARDINAL judges were separately asked to go to the Commissioner of Police .
On the ORG 's side , I want to assure everyone that this case will continue to be investigated to the end and that steps will be taken according to law .

TIME I informed the President of GPE about this all . Afterwards I also informed the Leader of the Opposition . We agreed that the matter is of national importance and that in no way should it be treated as a matter of partisan politics . I thank the Leader of the Opposition for this who like me understands the seriousness of the situation .
Afterwards I called a ORG meeting and it was decided to call ORG .

I appeal to the public to wait for the results of the investigations according to law and to consider that what is happening is a confirmation that the institutions of our land apply to everyone . Therefore , the public must still maintain its whole trust in them ” .

During the press conference , the Prime Minister was accompanied by his assistant , by the Minister of ORG and by the Minister of ORG . The press conference was shown live on the national television and several articles about it were published in the national newspapers .
On DATE the applicants were charged before ORG as a ORG .

Considering that the press conference and the publicity given to it had prejudiced their rights to a fair trial and to the presumption of innocence ( LAW and CARDINAL of the Convention and Article CARDINAL § § CARDINAL and CARDINAL of the LAW of GPE ) , at the first hearing before ORG , the applicants requested that the criminal proceedings be stayed and that their complaint be brought before ORG ( FAC ) in its constitutional jurisdiction .

In an order of CARDINAL DATE ORG considered that the applicants ' claim was not frivolous or vexatious as far as it concerned the press conference and referred the case to ORG . ORG rejected the applicants ' allegations regarding the alleged prejudice suffered because of the publicity given to the statements of the Prime Minister .

Before ORG , the applicants produced several newspaper articles which allegedly treated them as guilty . They also referred to a motion for their removal from duty which was pending before ORG . They alleged that , as there had been a breach of the presumption of innocence , no fair hearing was possible in their case .

In a judgment of DATE ORG held that the declarations made in the press conference could not be considered as statements of guilt and therefore declared that the applicants ' fundamental rights had not been breached . ORG directed ORG to continue the criminal proceedings instituted before it .

ORG first observed that the facts of the case were extraordinary and rather unique for GPE and that it was justified for the Prime Minister to call the press conference in order to inform the public and to avoid an institutional crisis . After having explained the background of the case , the Prime Minister gave assurances that the matter would have to be investigated according to law and requested the public to await the results of these investigations . Answering questions from the media , he reiterated that no conclusion could be drawn at that stage of the proceedings and that the applicants , like any other person , should enjoy the rights set forth in the law . In ORG opinion , these statements were not clear indications of guilt . The terms employed were those which were generally used on occasions in which reference was made to an ongoing investigation and to the results achieved by the police .
ORG recalled that according to the case - law of ORG , the presumption of innocence could not prevent the authorities from informing the public about the investigations in criminal matters .
The applicants appealed to ORG against the judgment of DATE .

In a judgment of DATE the ORG revoked the impugned decision and declared that there had been a violation of the applicants ' rights to a fair trial and to be presumed innocent . It further ordered that a copy of its judgment be placed in the records of the criminal proceedings pending against the applicants .

ORG noted that ORG should have addressed also the applicants ' complaint concerning the alleged lack of objective impartiality of the tribunal called upon to decide their case . However , this claim was unfounded , as even assuming that the presumption of innocence had been violated , this would not imply that the criminal proceedings could not be determined by an objectively independent and impartial court . The domestic legal system provided effective safeguards and guarantees in this respect .

ORG further observed that the authorities should impart information about pending criminal cases with the necessary caution and circumspection and that it could not be held that this requirement was satisfied simply because some reservations as to the need to await the result of the trial had been made . According to the case - law of ORG , the presumption of innocence was violated if a statement of a public official concerning a person charged with a criminal offence reflected an opinion that he was guilty before he had been proved so according to law . Even in the absence of a formal finding , it was sufficient that there was some reasoning suggesting that the official regarded the accused as guilty . The choice of words by the public official was of paramount importance but the existence of a breach of LAW had to be determined in the context of the particular circumstances in which the impugned statement had been made .

In the present case , the Prime Minister had used the words “ it became known ” and “ it resulted ” , which were incompatible with the required caution . It was , in fact , a clear declaration that the facts of which the applicants were accused had actually taken place , thus suggesting that the Prime Minister was considering the applicants guilty . This also resulted from some extracts of the press articles produced by the applicants , which showed that the reservations made at the end of the press conference did not have much effect on public opinion , which was de facto encouraged to believe that the accused had committed a criminal offence .

As the presumption of innocence was one of the elements of a fair criminal trial , the violation of paragraph CARDINAL of Article CARDINAL of the ORG also and necessarily entailed a breach of the first paragraph of this provision and of LAW .

In the light of its finding that there was no lack of objective impartiality on the part of the national tribunals , ORG considered that there was no room for ordering the suspension of the criminal proceedings against the applicants . However , it held that in order to provide a remedy for the violations found , and also with the ultimate aim of providing scrupulously and applying all safeguards contemplated and contained in LAW , its judgment should be brought to the attention of the court which would eventually be called upon to determine the criminal proceedings initiated against the applicants .
On DATE the applicants requested ORG to suspend the trial pending a decision from ORG .

In an order of DATE ORG rejected the applicants ' claim and decided to continue with the collection of evidence . It observed that considerations of public order militated against the requests of the defence and that in its judgment of CARDINAL DATE ORG had explicitly excluded the need to stop the criminal proceedings against the applicants .
